trans-unit.source: Provides a user interface for a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.WindowsFormsComponentEditor"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm> shows a view of available component editor pages along with a user interface for selection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm"></xref> class.
The component to be edited.
The set of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage"></xref> objects to be shown in the form.
component is not an .
Resize the form according to the setting of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form.AutoSizeMode"></xref>.
`true` if the form will automatically resize; `false` if it must be manually resized.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form.AutoSize"></xref> property changes.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form.Activated"></xref> event.
The first time the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm.OnActivated%2A> method is executed, it shows the first component editor page in the list.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm.OnActivated%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.HelpRequested"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm.OnHelpRequested%2A> method shows the Help page that is associated with the component editor page, if there is one.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm.OnHelpRequested%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Switches between component editor pages.
The source of the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
A designer file is checked into source code control and cannot be changed.
Provides a method to override in order to preprocess input messages before they are dispatched.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm.PreProcessMessage%2A> is called by the application's message loop to preprocess input messages before they are dispatched.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> that specifies the message to preprocess.
`true` if the specified message is for a component editor page; otherwise, `false`.
Shows the form.
The form will have no owner window.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult"></xref> values indicating the result code returned from the dialog box.
Shows the specified page of the specified form.
The form will have no owner window.
The index of the page to show.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult"></xref> values indicating the result code returned from the dialog box.
Shows the form with the specified owner.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window"></xref> to own the dialog.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult"></xref> values indicating the result code returned from the dialog box.
Shows the form and the specified page with the specified owner.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window"></xref> to own the dialog.
The index of the page to show.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult"></xref> values indicating the result code returned from the dialog box.
